Posts.Content: Many thanks for your reply. If my PSA was initially elevated because of the Urinary Tract Infection, should it have returned to normal after 2 weeks ? Rob
Posts.Title: Worried - Enlarged Prostate

Posts.Content: Thanks, I'll be back after my visit to the hospital. 2 weeks for a Urology appointment, then another 2 weeks to get a biopsy result leaves a great deal of worrying time Rob
Posts.Title: Worried - Enlarged Prostate

Posts.Content: Thanks again for your replies - Being able to discuss this has been very helpful in calming me down, and rationalising my worries. As far as I know there is not a family history of PC. I haven't actually asked my parents as I don't want to concern them at this stage. I do have slight urination problems, though they seem to be improving a bit. I hadn't considered the possibility that I might have BPH masking PC, I guess a biopsy is inevitable, though I'm still fearful of the thought of the procedure, and obviously the results.. Rob
Posts.Title: Worried - Enlarged Prostate

Posts.Content: Many thanks for your reply. If my PSA was initially elevated because of the Urinary Tract Infection, should it have returned to normal after 2 weeks ? Rob
Posts.Title: Worried - Enlarged Prostate

Posts.Content: Hi All, I'm really anxious at the moment and would really appreciate some advice. I'm 46 years old, did a long bike ride in the hot weather recently. I felt ill that evening, and found it difficult to pee. Went to my doctor who prescribed antibiotics for a UTI, and had a blood test 2 weeks later. My PSA level was 2.6, and my doctor said that I had a "Biggish Prostate" and has sent me off to the Urologist (I have a appointment in 1 week). I still feel a sort of "pressing" feeling in my pubic area, and feel the need to pee often. The info from the Urologist regarding biopsies, MRI scans hsa really scared me - My legs were shaking as I was reading the letter! I have a few questions that I'd really appreciate answers to as they keep going round and round in my head. If this is prostate cancer, does the fact that it is symptomatic mean that it will be advanced ? Is there any chance that the PSA level is elevated owing to the recent UT infection ? Am I too young for this to be BPH ? Many thanks for reading Rob
Posts.Title: Worried - Enlarged Prostate
